celestestrangelove: This resonated so deeply with me, thank you for sharing. You have been instrumental in my journey of sexual liberation. And for so many others too, as is evident from all the comments 💖
beck_ugh: I find it particularly difficult for us folx in, or peripheral to, sex work fields to give ourselves permission to not be perfect paragons of sexuality. It's hard to encapsulate the duality of owning my sexuality and expressing it while also teaching those around me that such an expression does NOT mean I am necessarily sexual 24/7 and in no way gives anyone permission to sexualize me without consent. In some ways I feel that working so closely with sexual discourse and the complicated bundle that is the psychology of sex makes me more likely to shut down and experience periods of sexual "hibernation." Sometimes it feels like others are reaping all of the benefits of me bringing up and unpacking taboos and stigmas around me while I am left drained and the furthest thing from turned on. Thank you for sharing your own difficulties along your journey. Wishing you love and light 💛✨
kylie_justine: as someone who is in a very similar space, thank you for your work ❤
brubsgardel: Thank you for writing about this. As somebody who's starting my journey, all these struggles sometimes seems like I'm the only one in the planet who has them, like there's something wrong with me. But I realize that liberation truly is a journey, that I have the rest of my life to figure this out. Thank you lady 💕
